reviewText: My 3yr old loves it!
My three year old loves trains and this one is a big hit with him.
Could have used more video about the trains and less staged shots. A little more history would have added to.this video.

Thank you Amazon for having such great films for free to watch. I love all of the Pentrex rail films and this one was super good too. If you like trains, you will have to rent this one or get it for free with PRIME.
My son loves trains and this show is perfect for him.
Son loves trains, especially this orange one....
we really enjoyed the 'ride' on firetv. It was wonderfully presented and put together. We will probably watch it again in the future.
Very interesting program about several working steam engines.

Excellent quality as usual from Pentrex and the sounds of the various steam whistles and the many scenes of billowing steam emanating from stacks, cylinder cocks, blow-off valves, whistles, etc., made the video extremely entertaining and worthwhile for a nostalgic escape to earlier times.  Well done!
Nice video. The kids love to watch the steam engines. Not a ton of dialogue, but enough to tell each engine's story.
This was really boring.
My three year old son has been obsessed with train documentaries lately and this is one of his favorites.
My son has autism and this has been his favorite for months now!  We watch it MANY times in one sitting!
These rail videos, originally by Pentrex are excellent. The camera work and narration are superb. These are the best in their class.
I've been wanting to get this for years and this DVD has sure exceeded my expectations. It showed some of the biggest steam locomotives in America from Union Pacific 3985 to Milwaukee Road 261
Great movie on steam trains, my grandson love it.
Son loves it!
Great to watch repeatedly with grandson!
Very entertaining. Lots of good footage and I learned a few things too!

The only reason I happened to watch this movie is because my 3 year old son loves trains. This movie kept his attention through out the entire duration of the movie. So he would probably rate it 5 stars if given the chance to. I rated it 3 stars because I found it to be rather boring and repetitive. The movie appeared to replay many scenes shot from slightly different camera angles. The movie is a delight for the kiddos, and informative for grownups, but not entertaining for me.
Extreme Steam has been enjoyed over and over (and over) again and again by my 33 month old grandson, his Dad and myself. He prefers this edition of Extreme Steam!
My son enjoyed this and the other movies in the series enough to watch them multiple times.
Simply amazing.
I love trains! This was great to watch the old steam trains of today in action. Very Good!!!!
